DataElement.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Official Title ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A key document that, together with the study protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), prospectively defines the study's Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) infrastructure and, in particular, the DMC's responsibilities; stipulates who sees blinded results and who sees unblinded results; and establishes a method for communication between the DMC and the sponsor. The formal title of the document.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Official Title
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:A group delegated to consider some matter; a self-constituted organization to promote something.:A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Established by authority or sanction.:An official descriptive name of a document, e.g. the long name of a study protocol provided by the study sponsor.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:A group delegated to consider some matter; a self-constituted organization to promote something.:A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).
A group delegated to consider matters concerning clinical studies or trials.
A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: Established by authority or sanction.:An official descriptive name of a document, e.g. the long name of a study protocol provided by the study sponsor.

Concepts.definition: An official descriptive name of a document, e.g. the long name of a study protocol provided by the study sponsor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Character string datatype stands for text data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
